p.strong: Hit Points. Hit Dice: 1d10 per Knight level. Hit Points at 1st Level: 10 + your Constitution modifier. Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per Knight level after 1st.
Proficiencies. Armor: Light Armour, Medium Armour, Shields. Weapons: Simple Blasters, Simple and Martial Lightweapons, Simple and Martial Vibroweapons. Saving Throws: Wisdom and Charisma.
Skills. Choose 2 from Athletics, Intimidation, Persuasion, Insight, Performance.
Spell Save DC. 8 + Charisma modifier + Proficiency Bonus.
Focus. Focus is the resource you use to activate certain abilities. You always start with max Focus after any rest. You can regain Focus through the Meditation ability.

tr.td: Spellcasting, Focus, Force Push, Force Pull, Valor, Minor Telekinesis, Meditation

sheet.description: A Force-sensitive guardian wielding a lightsaber to protect the galaxy.

setters.set: A Force-sensitive guardian wielding a lightsaber to protect the galaxy.
Light armor, medium armor, shields, simple blasters, simple and martial lightweapons, simple and martial vibroweapons

description.p: Focus is the resource you use to activate certain abilities. You always start with max Focus after any rest. You can regain Focus through the Meditation ability.
Your Focus increases as you gain levels, as shown in the Focus column of the Knight table.

sheet.description: You have {{focus:max}} Focus points.

description.p: A Knight's power comes from the light side of the Force. You have learned to draw on this power to cast spells.

Spellcasting Ability. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Knight spells, since the power of your magic relies on your ability to project your will into the world. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Knight spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell Save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
Spell Attack Modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
Meditate on the battlefield to gain 2 Focus when it is your turn again. While in this state, you can't take Reactions and you are considered Incapacitated.

sheet.description: Meditate on the battlefield to gain 2 Focus when it is your turn again. While in this state, you can't take Reactions and you are considered Incapacitated.

description.p: 1 Focus, Action. Use the Force to push someone away. Each creature in a 15-foot line must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 kinetic damage and are pushed 10 feet away. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't pushed. Per extra Focus spent to a max of half your Knight level (rounded up), the ability deals an additional 1d8 kinetic damage and pushes 5 extra feet.

sheet.description: 1 Focus, 1 Action. Range: Self. 15-foot line, Con save. Fail: 2d8 kinetic + pushed 10 feet. Success: half damage, not pushed. Extra Focus: +1d8 damage and +5 feet push per Focus (max half Knight level).

description.p: 1 Focus, Action. Use the Force to pull someone toward you. Each creature within a 15-foot cone originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 kinetic damage and are pulled 10 feet closer. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't pulled. Per extra Focus spent to a max of half your Knight level (rounded up), the ability deals an additional 1d8 kinetic damage, increases the cone size by 5 feet, and pulls creatures an additional 5 feet.

sheet.description: 1 Focus, 1 Action. Range: Self. 15-foot cone, Con save. Fail: 2d8 kinetic + pulled 10 feet. Success: half damage, not pulled. Extra Focus: +1d8 damage, +5 feet cone, +5 feet pull per Focus (max half Knight level).

description.p: 1 Focus, Action. You give courage to up to 3 creatures within 30 feet. The target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to an attack roll or saving throw. Per extra Focus spent to a max of half your Knight level (rounded up), you can target one additional creature.

sheet.description: 1 Focus, 1 Action. Range: 30 feet. Duration: Concentration, up to 10 turns. Target up to 3 creatures. They can add d4 to an attack roll or saving throw. Extra Focus: +1 target per Focus (max half Knight level).

description.p: 1 Focus, Action. You use the Force to manipulate a small or medium object, or a small creature, that you can see within 45 feet. You make an ability check using your Force ability, contested by the target's Strength check. On a success, you may suspend and/or move up to 30 feet or throw the target. If you choose to suspend the target, it remains suspended for the duration. If you throw the target, make a ranged Force attack with a range of 30/60 feet. On a hit, the target you throw at takes kinetic damage based on what is thrown: Small object: 2d4 kinetic damage, Medium object: 2d6 kinetic damage, Small creature: 1d4 kinetic damage. If a creature is thrown, the thrown small creature takes 1d8 + your Force ability modifier kinetic damage.

sheet.description: 1 Focus, 1 Action. Range: 45 feet. Duration: Concentration, up to 1 round. Force check vs target's Str. Success: suspend/move 30 feet or throw (30/60 range). Thrown object damage: Small 2d4, Medium 2d6, Small creature 1d4 to target + 1d8+mod to thrown creature.

description.p: At 2nd level, you choose a Lightsaber Form that defines your combat style: Makashi, Soresu, Ataru, Shien, Djem So, Niman, or Juyo. Your form grants you features at 2nd level.

1 Focus, Action. Make a ranged attack of 30/60 with your melee weapon using your Dexterity modifier for attack and damage rolls. If you are proficient with you weapon you add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll. Per extra Focus spent to a max of half your Knight level (rounded up), your range increases by 10/15 feet.

sheet.description: 1 Focus, 1 Action. Range: Self. Ranged attack 30/60 with melee weapon using Dex. Proficiency bonus added if proficient. Extra Focus: +10/15 range per Focus (max half Knight level).

description.p: 2 Focus, Bonus Action. When Incapacitated, you can use this ability to end that condition.

sheet.description: 2 Focus, 1 Bonus Action. Range: Self. End Incapacitated condition on yourself.

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

2 Focus, Action. You wave your hand and speak a simple command to a creature you can see within 60 feet. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must follow the command on its next turn. On a successful save, the creature isn't tricked and if the creature isn't in combat, it will make an Arcana check against your Spell save DC to determine whether it knows you tried to mind trick it. This ability has no effect if the target is a Droid, does not understand your language, or is not intelligent enough. Per extra Focus spent to a max of half your Knight level (rounded up), you can target an additional creature.

sheet.description: 2 Focus, 1 Action. Range: 60 feet. Target Wis save or follows command on next turn. No effect on Droids or unintelligent creatures. Extra Focus: +1 target per Focus (max half Knight level).

description.p: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, whenever you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you must make a saving throw, that creature can add your Charisma modifier to the saving throw.

sheet.description: You and friendly creatures within 10 feet can add your Charisma modifier to saving throws.

description.p: 2 Focus, Action. When you successfully hit with a melee attack, you can use this ability to try to blind the creature you hit. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is blinded for 1 round. On a successful save, the creature isn't blinded.

sheet.description: 2 Focus, 1 Action. Range: Self. When you hit with melee attack, target Con save or blinded for 1 round.

description.p: At 9th level, your meditation deepens. You now gain 3 Focus when you meditate instead of 2.

sheet.description: Meditation now grants 3 Focus instead of 2.

description.p: At 10th level, your Aura of Presence strengthens. You and friendly creatures within 10 feet can't be Frightened.

sheet.description: You and friendly creatures within 10 feet can't be Frightened.

description.p: Starting at 11th level, you can channel the Force into your strikes. When making a melee attack, you can spend 1 Focus to deal an additional 1d8 damage.

sheet.description: Spend 1 Focus when making a melee attack to deal an additional 1d8 damage.

description.p: At 14th level, you can use Force Resolution on other creatures as well. Range becomes Touch.

sheet.description: Force Resolution can target others. Range: Touch.

description.p: At 15th level, you have mastered meditation in combat. You are no longer considered Incapacitated when using the Meditation ability.

sheet.description: You are no longer Incapacitated when using Meditation.

description.p: At 17th level, your Aura of Presence grants resistance to ranged attacks. You and friendly creatures within 10 feet have resistance to damage from ranged attacks.

sheet.description: You and friendly creatures within 10 feet have resistance to damage from ranged attacks.

description.p: At 18th level, the range of your Aura of Presence increases to 20 feet.

sheet.description: Your Aura of Presence range increases to 20 feet.

description.p: At 20th level, your Aura of Presence revitalizes your allies. When a friendly creature starts its turn within your Aura of Presence, that creature gains temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom or Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

sheet.description: Friendly creatures starting their turn in your aura gain temp HP equal to your Wis or Cha modifier (min 1).

description.p: Makashi is a dueling form focused on precision and finesse. Practitioners gain the Dueling fighting style and learn to Riposte against their enemies.
You gain the Dueling Fighting Style.

sheet.description: You gain the Dueling Fighting Style.

description.p: 1 Focus, Reaction. When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

sheet.description: 1 Focus, 1 Reaction. Range: Self. When a creature misses you with a melee attack, make a melee weapon attack against them.

description.p: Soresu is a defensive form designed to protect against all attacks. Practitioners learn to Block melee attacks and Deflect ranged attacks.
1 Focus, Reaction. Block to negate a melee attack that would have hit you.

sheet.description: 1 Focus, 1 Reaction. Range: Self. Negate a melee attack that would have hit you.

description.p: 1 Focus, Reaction. Must wield a lightweapon. Use the Force to deflect a ranged attack that would have hit you. This also works on Force Lightning abilities. This does not work against weapons that deal sonic or kinetic damage.

sheet.description: 1 Focus, 1 Reaction. Range: Self. Deflect a ranged attack (not sonic/kinetic) or Force Lightning while wielding a lightweapon.

description.p: Ataru is an aggressive acrobatic form. Practitioners learn to leap great distances and fall gracefully.

1 Focus, Action. Jump up to twice your movement and make a melee weapon attack. This does not provoke Opportunity Attacks. Per extra Focus spent to a max of half your Knight level (rounded up), you can jump an additional 5 feet.

sheet.description: 1 Focus, 1 Action. Range: Self. Jump up to 2x movement and attack. No OA. Extra Focus: +5 feet per Focus (max half level).

description.p: 1 Focus, Reaction. Use the Force to slow yourself when falling, taking only half fall damage.

sheet.description: 1 Focus, 1 Reaction. Range: Self. Take half fall damage.

description.p: Shien focuses on deflecting ranged attacks back at attackers. Practitioners learn to Redirect incoming attacks.

1 Focus, Reaction. Must wield a lightweapon. Use the Force to send a ranged attack that would have hit you to a creature. This counts as a ranged Force attack with the range of the incoming attack. This also works on Force Lightning abilities. This does not work against weapons that deal sonic or kinetic damage.

sheet.description: 1 Focus, 1 Reaction. Range: Self. Redirect a ranged attack (not sonic/kinetic) or Force Lightning at a creature while wielding a lightweapon.

description.p: Djem So emphasizes brute strength and overpowering offense. Practitioners learn Passionate Strike and Deflect.
2 Focus, Action. Make a melee attack and gain advantage on that attack.

sheet.description: 2 Focus, 1 Action. Range: Self. Make a melee attack with advantage.

description.p: 1 Focus, Reaction. Must wield a lightweapon. Use the Force to deflect a ranged attack that would have hit you. This also works on Force Lightning abilities. This does not work against weapons that deal sonic or kinetic damage.

sheet.description: 1 Focus, 1 Reaction. Range: Self. Deflect a ranged attack (not sonic/kinetic) or Force Lightning while wielding a lightweapon.

description.p: Niman balances all aspects of combat. Practitioners can use Force Push and Force Pull as Bonus Actions.
You can use Force Push and Force Pull as Bonus Actions instead of Actions.

sheet.description: You can use Force Push and Force Pull as Bonus Actions.

description.p: Juyo is an aggressive form that channels raw emotion into devastating attacks. Practitioners learn Cyclone to unleash flurries of strikes.

2 Focus, Action. Make a flurry of attacks in one swift movement. You make two attacks that count as one attack against the same target. You roll both to hit. Per 2 extra Focus spent to a max of half your Knight level (rounded up), you make an additional attack within that flurry.

sheet.description: 2 Focus, 1 Action. Range: Self. Make two attacks as one against the same target. Extra Focus: +1 attack per 2 Focus (max half level).
